treasury_media.title: Yale PET Scientists receive Early Career Investigator travel awards for 2019 BRAIN PET Meeting
treasury_media.description: Takuya Toyonaga, Xiaotian Fang, and Pragalath Sadasivam were awarded Early Career Investigator travel awards by the International Society for Cerebral Blood Flow & Metabolism (ISCBFM) to attend the BRAIN & BRAIN PET conference in Yokohama, Japan.

authors.headline: Praktijkdocent at Hogeschool van Arnhem en Nijmegen (HAN)

profile_positions.description:
- Lead clinical evaluation for obtaining regulatory approval (FDA, CE)
- Data management, analysis, visualization to support decision-making and guide product design
- Automate, present, communicate data-driven insights to address business needs
profile_positions.title: Clinical Data Scientist

profile_positions.description:
- Development of ML-based methods for data-driven analysis
- Project lead on collaborative and interdisciplinary research focused on discovery of novel clinical biomarkers
- Assessing treatment efficacy of novel therapeutics with synaptic density PET imaging in Alzheimer's disease
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Associate

profile_positions.description:
- Investigated Alzheimer's disease in preclinical models
- Designed and developed recombinant antibody-based radioligands to visualize soluble pathological proteins related to Alzheimer's disease
- Performed radiolabeling and small animal PET and MR imaging, as well as data analysis and PET quantification
